The '''Screen''' refers to the visual display of the game. Various screen elements such as graphics, brightness, camera angle, and shake can be adjusted in the [[Settings]].

==Field of Vision==
Sometimes environmental factors or [[enemies]] can obstruct the field of vision on the screen:
*[[Treasure Hoarders: Gravedigger]]
*[[Treasure Hoarders: Carmen]]
*[[The Great Snowboar King]]
*[[Dusty Balloon]]
*[[Kaboomball Kombat#Foggy-Groggy Ball|Foggy-Groggy Ball]]

Various other factors can affect the field of vision including [[Elemental Sight]].

==Camera Shake==
When certain abilities or used, or when melee attacks hit targets, the camera will shake. Camera shake has the following parameters:<ref name="src">Source Data: [https://github.com/Dimbreath/GenshinData/tree/master/BinOutput/Ability/Temp/AvatarAbilities Character Abilities]</ref>
*"shakeType"
*"shakeRange": supposedly in [[meter]]s
*"shakeTime": supposedly in [[second]]s
*"shakeDistance": supposedly in [[meter]]s
*"shakeDir": x, y, z directions
*"baseCycle"
*"cycleDamping"
*"rangeAttenuation"

===Forced Camera Shake===
Abilities with a Forced Camera Shake will cause a Camera Shake even if they do not hit a target. This mainly applies to [[explosion]]s (such as [[Overloaded]]) or ground-smashing attacks.
